text: Mason Betha, known simply as Mase, (stylized as Ma$e; born August 27, 1975) is an American rapper and minister. Mase first performed under the name Murda Mase. ==Life== Mase was born on August 27, 1975 in Jacksonville, Florida. He grew up in Harlem, New York City. In 1993, he formed the group Children of the Corn ("corn" short for "corner") with fellow Harlem rappers Killa Cam, Big L, Herb McGruff and Bloodshed. Mase's first album, Harlem World (1997), was certified quadruple platinum by the RIAA. His second albums, Double Up (1999) and Welcome Back (2004), were certified gold. ==Other websites== * * El Elyon International Church Category:1975 births Category:American Christians Category:American movie actors Category:American songwriters Category:Living people Category:Actors from New York City Category:Musicians from Jacksonville, Florida Category:People from Harlem Category:Rappers from Florida Category:Singer-songwriters from New York City Category:Writers from Florida Category:20th-century American rappers Category:21st-century American rappers
title: Mase
